form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sullivan introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To require each agency to repeal or amend 1 or more rules before issuing or amending a rule.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Regulations Endanger Democracy Act of 2015 or the RED Tape Act of 2015.

section.header: Repeal of rules required before issuing or amending rule

paragraph.text: the term agency has the meaning given that term in section 551 of title 5, United States Code;

the term covered rule means a rule of an agency that causes a new financial or administrative burden on businesses in the United States or on the people of the United States, as determined by the head of the agency;

subparagraph.text: has the meaning given that term in section 551 of title 5, United States Code; and

clause.text: any rule issued by an agency pursuant to an Executive order or Presidential memorandum; and
any rule issued by an agency due to the issuance of a memorandum, guidance document, bulletin, or press release issued by an agency; and

paragraph.text: the term Unified Agenda means the Unified Agenda of Federal Regulatory and Deregulatory Actions.

subsection.header: Prohibition on issuance of certain rules

subparagraph.text: issue a covered rule that does not amend or modify an existing rule of the agency, unless—

clause.text: the agency has repealed 1 or more existing covered rules of the agency; and
the cost of the covered rule to be issued is less than or equal to the cost of the covered rules repealed under clause (i), as determined and certified by the head of the agency; or

subparagraph.text: issue a covered rule that amends or modifies an existing rule of the agency, unless—

clause.text: the agency has repealed or amended 1 or more existing covered rules of the agency; and
the cost of the covered rule to be issued is less than or equal to the cost of the covered rules repealed or amended under clause (i), as determined and certified by the head of the agency.

paragraph.header: Penalty for failure to repeal or amend rules
paragraph.text: During the period beginning on the date of failure to comply by an agency with paragraph (1) in issuing a covered rule, and ending on the date on which the agency complies with paragraph (1) with respect to that covered rule, no statutory pay adjustment (as defined in section 147(b) of the Continuing Appropriations Act, 2011 (5 U.S.C. 5303 note)) shall take effect with respect to any employee of the agency.
Paragraph (1) shall not apply to the issuance of a covered rule by an agency that—

subparagraph.text: relates to the internal policy or practice of the agency or procurement by the agency; or
is being revised to be less burdensome to decrease requirements imposed by the covered rule or the cost of compliance with the covered rule.

subsection.text: In determining whether to repeal a covered rule under subparagraph (A)(i) or (B)(i) of subsection (b)(1), the head of the agency that issued the covered rule shall consider—

paragraph.text: whether the covered rule achieved, or has been ineffective in achieving, the original purpose of the covered rule;
any adverse effects that could materialize if the covered rule is repealed, in particular if those adverse effects are the reason the covered rule was originally issued;
whether the costs of the covered rule outweigh any benefits of the covered rule to the United States;
whether the covered rule has become obsolete due to changes in technology, economic conditions, market practices, or any other factors; and
whether the covered rule overlaps with a covered rule to be issued by the agency.

subsection.header: Publication of covered rules in Unified Agenda

paragraph.text: Each agency shall, on a semiannual basis, submit jointly and without delay to the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs for publication in the Unified Agenda a list containing—

subparagraph.text: each covered rule that the agency intends to issue during the 6-month period following the date of submission;
each covered rule that the agency intends to repeal or amend in accordance with subsection (b) during the 6-month period following the date of submission; and
the cost of each covered rule described in subparagraphs (A) and (B).

paragraph.text: An agency may not issue a covered rule unless the agency complies with the requirements under paragraph (1).
